name: Mercure Hotel Duesseldorf City Center

reviews.text: Just had one night at the Mercure. It is a standard Mercure, our twin room was fairly small but clean, quite modern, beds were comfortable. Location was excellent. Bathroom clean and quite spacious. Only gripe was the AC - i had the temperature turned down as low as possible but it didnt seem to do anything - so had to open the window to cool down, which then meant we heard every police car/ambulance that went buy during the night. I would definitely stay here again as it is great value at £60 but make sure the room temperature control works first.
reviews.title: Great value, excellent location.

reviews.text: For a little over £50 per night for a single room, this hotel is good value though not particularly memorable as such. The £50 gets you a single room with a single bed in a very small room with a modern en-suite facility, though no bath (a bath wont fit in such a small room). The rooms, though pretty non-descript, were comfortable and quiet, though the air-con didnt seem to really do anything but make noise, so I switched it off. The staffare professional and courteus, but that's it really. Not a specialhotel, but comfortable, located in between the Kongisalle and the train station. Good base from which to explore nearby Cologne and Bonn. Breakfast is £12 per day extra, which is ridiculously expensive, considering the restaurant and bar are tiny. As such didnt opt for brekky so cannot vouch for the quality of the food. Note, also there's no room service or much food about the place. In summary, a well located and comfortable, good value but average hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, friendly service, good location

likes.disliked: — Small boring rooms - also 2.5 Euros for a small bag of crips?!?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is situated about 300 metres from the Hauptbahnhof and about 10-15 minutes walk from the Koningsalle and Altstadt, altough Dusseldorf in itself is very walkable.
reviews.title: Great hotel by the Hauptbanhof

reviews.text: Hotel has been recently modernised and rooms are of an ok sized. Nice bay type window with door that fully opened on to the balcony. Room facilities are good, Satellite TV, Honesty Minibar (can use as a fridge), In room safe (although the previous guest had locked this so this was not working!), Room also has Internet access which is a bit pricey at 15 Eur for 24 hours.
reviews.title: Good value

likes.liked: — It was clean, friendly and convenient for where we wanted to go.

reviews.text: Bathroom was nice size, and warm thanks to the Central Heating radiator in there, power shower and standard Mercure toiletries available.
reviews.title: Typically small rooms, good for a budget

reviews.text: We had a good experience when we stayed here for 3 nights in February. The hotel is less than a 5-minute walk from the main train station in Dusseldorf so it's a great location for traveling to other parts of the city or to other cities (Koln, Frankfurt, etc.) One thing to be aware of is the abundance of "adult entertainment" joints in the area.
reviews.title: Clean and efficient

reviews.text: The hotel itself is nice and clean. The staff is fairly friendly - allowed us to check in early when we arrived and called a taxi for us. The rooms are small, but clean and up-to-date.
reviews.title: Good budget choice
3 nights in Dusseldorf
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in the room price and was wonderful!
Would stay here again, especially given the price.
reviews.title: They call this a 2-star hotel? It's better than some 4*!

description: The 4 star Mercure Hotel Duesseldorf City Center offers 164 rooms and is located in the heart of Dusseldorf between the main railway station and the renowned Königsallee 800 m away. Providing ideal access to the exhibition centre and the international airport just 10 km away, the Mercure hotel also features the Apero bar, the Quatre Saisons brasserie, a terrace and three conference rooms.
